intro: Wikstroemia floribunda, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a glossy texture. It thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in shaded or partially shaded environments.
